sub_title: International Development Consultant | Certified Yoga Teacher | Join me this Autumn 🍁 for my RELAX & RECHARGE Yoga Retreat 🧘‍♀️ Rest and Refresh in the beautiful heart of the Dutch countryside
summary: Internationally accomplished Project Manager with 10 years’ experience and demonstrated results in operations, budget management, grants and subcontracts, and business development – both in the field and at HQ level. Outstanding expertise in working with a wide variety of stakeholders and donors, as well as developing cross-cultural relationships and partnerships. Self-motivated team player with strong leadership skills working across geographically dispersed teams. Specialized in sustainable agriculture and supply chains.

certifications.name: Technical Writing for USAID Proposals Course

profile_positions.description:
International Development consultant specializing in both Program Management and Business Development. Available for remote work as well as traveling assignments. Experience working with a wide range of donors from USAID/USDA to GIZ to the private sector.

Program Management experience includes: grants, operations, budgeting and finance, program design and strategy, reporting, start-up, recruitment, etc.

Business Development experience includes: costing, coordination, recon, section writing, etc.
profile_positions.title: International Development Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Yoga teacher with over 5 years of experience teaching to a diverse student group from around the world. Founded my own yoga group ‘Flow with Caitlin’ while living in Ethiopia. Experience teaching vinyasa, hatha, and restorative yoga, as well as pranayama and yoga philosophy. 
Currently teaching at Yoga Moves in Utrecht and available for private lessons. 
www.flowwithcaitlin.com
profile_positions.title: Certified Yoga Teacher

profile_positions.description:
Program Management: 
•	Responsible for day-to-day program management and internal coordination between FairMatch Support West Africa and FairMatch Support NL, specifically supporting RVO and GIZ funded projects in West Africa.
•	Created the Sustainable Nut Initiative guidance document for the cashew sector which guides SNI private sector partners step by step how to make their cashew supply chain more sustainable from farmer to retailer.
•	Wrote and developed a Barometer Report for the cashew sector. Report gives an overall view of the cashew sector, producing and processing countries, complex trade routes, sustainability issues and ways to address them, and major sector players.

Business Development: 
•	Wrote and managed a CBI tender focusing on the macadamia nut supply chain from Kenya to the European market. Responsible for gathering all inputs, ensuring compliance with tender, writing the proposal, verifying consultant rates, and final submission.
•	Developed the 2022 annual proposal and budget for the Sustainable Nut Initiative to be approved by the SNI board and then submitted to GIZ for funding approval.
•	Contributed to new business efforts by strategizing with partners how to expand existing programs. Co-designed the next phase of the project, focusing on developing a more circular supply chain.
•	Wrote concept notes for two different nut processing companies to generate work for FMS. The concept notes demonstrated how the services of FMS could benefit and contribute to sustainable growth of the companies.
profile_positions.title: Supply Chain Developer

profile_positions.description:
Program Management: 
•	Responsible for day-to-day program management of USDA funded FEED III project and managed internal coordination between departments, with the COP, as well as between the field office and headquarters.
•	Successfully managed the roll-out of $800K grant fund to spur the growth and marketing of the animal feed sector in Ethiopia to ensure communication is aligned, ensuring smooth project implementation.
•	Monitored, tracked, and updated project budget of approximately $9.3MM over 3 years. Responsible for life of project budget projections, budget realignments, and all required financial reporting. 
•	Wrote SOWs for both technical and administrative job postings and interviewed and recruited local staff.

Business Development: 
•	Conducted recon for USDA Coffee proposal. Met with various stakeholders such as the Ethiopian Commodity Exchange, the Cooperative Union Agency and Yirgacheffe Coffee Farmer Cooperative Union. Consolidated and fed information back to HQ.
•	Conducted research on baseline for USDA Coffee proposal to accurately determine project targets.
profile_positions.title: Operations and Program Manager, FEED III Project

profile_positions.description:
Program Management: 
•	Managed and oversaw project operations for the USAID funded NAFAKA II Activity. Directly line-managed a team of 5 and oversaw a larger team of 34 local staff, including the grants, finance, procurement, and volunteer staff.
•	Managed the $17MM budget including monitoring overall burn rate, spending for each budget line item, quarterly budget projections, putting together financial reports for USAID, conducted budget realignments.
•	Designed and managed 3 local subcontracts. Acted as point of contact for contract and financial management issues including submission of invoices, approvals for travel and labor, and contract modifications.
•	Created Standard Operating Procedures for each area of project operations including procurement, payment, travel and per diem, payroll, HR, fuel consumption, vehicle maintenance, etc. 
•	Acted as the Hiring Manager and successfully recruited the Director of Operations, Finance Manager, IT Manager, Administrative Officer, Volunteer Coordinator, Grants Assistant and Procurement Assistant.

Business Development: 
•	Met with USAID to discuss future pipeline projects and how ACDI/VOCA could better position itself to compete.
•	Met with other NGOs to discuss potential collaboration and partnering for upcoming bids.
profile_positions.title: Operations and Compliance Manager, NAFAKA II project

profile_positions.description:
Program Management:  
•	Provided backstopping support for USAID funded NAFAKA project in Tanzania and BHP Billiton funded LEAD project in Mozambique. Liaised between HQ, field offices, and USAID to ensure smooth implementation of day-to-day program activities.
•	Managed the 5-year budget valued at $34.8M. My strong budgeting and projection skills led to zero overspent funds. Only $35K was left unused at the end of the 5-year project.
•	Acted as DCOP for 2 months and ran the main NAFAKA field office, ensuring smooth project implementation and full compliance with USAID rules and regulations. Negotiated face-to-face with subcontractors to secure annual SOWs and budgets. 
•	Started-up USAID funded LPIN project in Bangladesh over 2 months. Recruited local staff, found office space, organized logistics.

Business Development: 
•	Conducted solo recon trip in Liberia for a DFAP proposal. Conducted over 30 meetings in two weeks, engaged with potential partners to form ACDI/VOCA’s consortium, and met with existing USAID projects to discuss opportunities for collaboration.
•	Created cost proposal for $17MM NAFAKA II project which was awarded to ACDI/VOCA by USAID.
•	Coordinated Bangladesh DFAP proposal. Ensured communication across the team was clear and all were on the same page. Ensured deadlines were met and deliverables were complete. 
•	Wrote sections of the Bangladesh DFAP proposal such as the personnel plan and corporate capabilities. Put together the organizational chart in visio.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Provided backstopping support for $8M USAID funded program in Malawi, Mozambique, and Angola to create sustainable impact and ensure F2F’s annual targets were met
•	Reviewed and edited scopes of work from the field to provide guidance to field staff and ensure proper implementation of the program strategy
•	Recruited and fielded agricultural experts to serve as volunteer consultants for the three program counties and managed all aspects of assignment logistics
•	Developed assessment tool to gather information to strategically assess assignment impact
profile_positions.title: Farmer-to-Farmer Program Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•	Analyzed DIG’s sustainability plan and researched sustainability plan best practices
•	Wrote technical note covering Gates Foundation funded program in Mombasa, Kenya which demonstrated best implementation practices and how the program could be replicated in other cities
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
• Provided administrative and technical support to program staff on $1.2 million USAID and $3.6 million Gates Foundation funded projects through research and administrative duties, contributing to day-to-day program management

• Drafted 2014 work plan, Gantt charts, and annual report, helping to produce deliverables submitted to donors

• Analyzed Monitoring and Evaluation proposals, leading to hiring of consultant best qualified to conduct assessment of program in Liberia

• Evaluated sustainability plan for projects, helping to determine which exit strategy should be implemented on the ground

• Developed marketing materials for WASH and municipal governance projects as well as produce news roundups for DIG countries

• Researched and analyzed past RFPs and proposals, helping to improve DIG’s business development efforts
profile_positions.title: Program Support Intern

profile_positions.description:
• Led in-depth workshop in Portuguese teaching hands-on production and post-production process, resulting in a video the organization can use for advocacy, marketing, and donor communications

• Built capacity of Save the Children local staff, enabling staff to gain technical skills and obtain measureable results

• Directed the interview process at a rural school, helping to foster strong relationships between Save the Children and members of the community
profile_positions.title: Workshop Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Provided programmatic support on €3.4 million project portfolio, resulting in the continued success of BCI’s projects and development

• Managed technical and financial components of projects by overseeing the London office budget and spending, completing Program Director’s expense reports, and managing invoices and drafting contracts for consultants

• Organized working group meetings and facilitated communication between BCI, corporate donors, and implementing partners, resulting in the growth, development, and sustainability of the Better Cotton supply chain

• Supported BCI Fast Track investment program by managing application process and documenting 4-day meeting in Dubai, leading to the funding of Better Cotton projects and an increased number of implementing partners

• Liaised directly with corporate partners (Nike, IKEA, Walmart, etc.) to coordinate travel and visas for BCI’s international supply chain conference in Geneva
profile_positions.title: Program Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Produce, shoot, and edit marketing videos for clients such as Fair Trade USA, Rimon Law Firm, and CV Channel

• Design and develop a video producer training curriculum and manual for recruiters to produce their own media, leading to the business development and client expansion of CV Channel

• Coordinate and facilitate production training session, furthering the knowledge, technical skills, and ability of participants
profile_positions.title: Freelance Project Manager and Consultant

profile_positions.description:
• Managed and produced multiple video projects, resulting in the promotion and marketing of programs as well as fundraising for the organization

• Facilitated communication with regional offices and vendors to coordinate the production, content, and deliverables of projects
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator & Producer
